heisig_chinese_memo: A metal pot with non-thermoconductive jawbones as handles.&nbsp
heisig_constituent: pot, metal, gold, jawbone, joint, hood, mouth
koohiiStory1: A gruesome kind of cauldron that Snape might have used is a metal pot in the shape of a skull.
koohiiStory2: A metall pot with non-thermoconductive jawbones as handholds.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A gold man has one mustache above his lip and one mustache below his lip and keeps all his extra mustaches safely tucked away in a pot. This man is made of gold and has a lot of money. That’s how he can afford to groom two mustaches at the same time. If anything should happen to one, he has plenty of back up mustaches in his mustache storage pot.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this double mustachioed gold man as he rifles through his pot of mustaches. Imagine how ticklish they must be.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The mustachioed man’s wife asks if he loves his pot of mustaches more than he loves her. “Nah babe (なべ),” he says. “Nah, babe. Nah.”
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself as this golden man with the mustache (and another mustache). Say “Nah, babe” over and over again like you’re trying to convince your wife that you actually love her more than your pot of luxurious mustaches.
Ru_trainchinese: guō: (сущ) сковорода, кастрюля; котел; котлообразный предмет
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the gold (金) there's gossip (咼) about is your pot
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: At the hot pot restaurant the metal heats up that delicious spicy meat and burns you so good from the mouth, all the way through the esophagus, and down to your stomach.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " gold ", the sound of " choo " indicates that the ointment container is often used as an appliance for steaming food. Volume 9 of "Dialect": "The person who holds the ointment is called the pot." Qian Yi wrote: "The ointment is applied to the car, so the name of the pot is also given." Therefore, the volume 9 of the "Dialect" also has: "The car tank It is called the pot among Yan, Qi, Hai, and Dai." "Jade Chapter ‧ Jin Bu": "The pot, the cream container."

" Wok " is often used as an appliance for steaming food. Jin Xuguang "The Story of a Dutiful Son": "Mother is good at cooking rice with pot bottom." Tang Huilin's "All Classics, Sounds and Meanings" Volume 14: "Pot, Burning Vessel." Tang Lu Guimeng "Ten Songs of Fenghe Ximei Tea Set·Tea Stove" : "Yingquan in the pot is boiling, full of clouds and buds are ripe."

Things that look like pots are also called " pans ". Liang Zhangju of the Qing Dynasty quoted in "Zhixiangge Miscellaneous Notes" in "Returning to the Field-Ji Wenda Shi": "Public people eat cigarettes, their smoking guns are very big, and the smoking pot is huge."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " gold " to "咼", it means an ointment container, which is often used as an appliance for cooking food.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「呙」聲，表示盛膏器，常用作蒸煮食物的器具。《方言》卷九：「盛膏者，乃謂之鍋。」錢繹箋疏：「膏施於車釭，故釭亦得其鍋名。」故《方言》卷九亦有：「車缸，燕、齊、海、岱之間謂之鍋。」《玉篇‧金部》：「鍋，盛膏器。」

　　「鍋」 常用作蒸煮食物的器具。晉徐廣《孝子傳》：「母好食鍋底焦飯。」唐慧琳《一切經音義》卷十四：「鍋，燒器也。」唐陸龜蒙《奉和襲美茶具十詠‧茶灶》：「盈鍋玉泉沸，滿甑雲芽熟。」

　　形狀像鍋之物亦稱為「鍋」。清梁章鉅《歸田瑣記‧紀文達師》引《芝香閣雜記》云：「公善吃煙，其煙槍甚巨，煙鍋又絕大。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「咼」聲，表示盛膏器，常用作蒸煮食物的器具。

鍋(なべ): saucepan, pot

從「 金 」，「 呙 」聲，表示盛膏器，常用作蒸煮食物的器具。《方言》卷九：「盛膏者，乃謂之鍋。」錢繹箋疏：「膏施於車釭，故釭亦得其鍋名。」故《方言》卷九亦有：「車缸，燕、齊、海、岱之間謂之鍋。」《玉篇‧金部》：「鍋，盛膏器。」 「 鍋 」 常用作蒸煮食物的器具。晉徐廣《孝子傳》：「母好食鍋底焦飯。」唐慧琳《一切經音義》卷十四：「鍋，燒器也。」唐陸龜蒙《奉和襲美茶具十詠‧茶灶》：「盈鍋玉泉沸，滿甑雲芽熟。」 形狀像鍋之物亦稱為「 鍋 」。清梁章鉅《歸田瑣記‧紀文達師》引《芝香閣雜記》云：「公善吃煙，其煙槍甚巨，煙鍋又絕大。」
From " gold", the sound of " choo" indicates that the ointment container is often used as an appliance for steaming food. Volume 9 of "Dialect": "The person who holds the ointment is called the pot." Qian Yi wrote: "The ointment is applied to the car, so the name of the pot is also given." Therefore, the volume 9 of the "Dialect" also has: "The car tank It is called the pot among Yan, Qi, Hai, and Dai." "Jade Chapter ‧ Jin Bu": "The pot, the cream container." " Wok" is often used as an appliance for steaming food. Jin Xuguang "The Story of a Dutiful Son": "Mother is good at cooking rice with pot bottom." Tang Huilin's "All Classics, Sounds and Meanings" Volume 14: "Pot, Burning Vessel." Tang Lu Guimeng "Ten Songs of Fenghe Ximei Tea Set·Tea Stove" : "Yingquan in the pot is boiling, full of clouds and buds are ripe." Things that look like pots are also called " pans". Liang Zhangju of the Qing Dynasty quoted in "Zhixiangge Miscellaneous Notes" in "Returning to the Field-Ji Wenda Shi": "Public people eat cigarettes, their smoking guns are very big, and the smoking pot is huge."

鍋字的基本解释

鍋
guō
见“锅”。

鍋字的汉语字典释义

[①]［guō］
［《廣韻》古禾切，平戈，見。］
“锅1”的繁体字。
(1)烹饪用具。圆形中凹，多用铁制。
(2)形状像锅的东西。
(3)用作量词。

鍋字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鍋； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1313第10
【廣韻】【韻會】【正韻】?古禾切，音戈。【玉篇】車釭。【揚子·方言】車釭，齊燕海岱之閒謂之鍋。　又【玉篇】盛膏器。【揚子·方言】自關而西，盛膏者乃謂之鍋。　又【廣韻】溫器。【正字通】俗謂釜爲鍋。　又【玉篇】公禍切，音過。義同。　又【集韻】古火切，音果。刈鉤也。與鐹同。　【集韻】或作鈛?。

鍋字的源字形

鍋字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［guō］
["Guangyun" Gu Heqie, Ping Ge, see. ]
Traditional characters for "锅1".
(1) Cooking utensils. Round concave, mostly made of iron.
(2) Something shaped like a pot.
(3) Used as a quantifier.
pot
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Guo; Kangxi strokes: 17; Page number: Page 1313 No. 10
[Guang Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Positive Rhyme]? Gu Heqie, Yin Ge. [Jade articles] Car Nightmare. [Yangtze Dialect] Che Yan, Qi Yan Haidai's leisure is called the pot.　[Jade articles] Ointment container. 【Yangtze Dialect】From Guanxi to the west, those who hold ointment are called pots.　[Guangyun] Thermometer. [Zhengzitong] It is commonly said that a kettle is a pot.　[Jade Chapter] Public misfortune is cut, the sound is over. The same meaning.　[Jiyun] Ancient fire cut, sound fruit. Mowing the hook also. Same as 鐹.　【Jiyun】Or as 鈛?.

guō
вм. 锅
Radicals: 金, 冋  (gold, mustache)
Meaning Mnemonic
A gold man has one mustache above his lip and one mustache below his lip and keeps all his extra mustaches safely tucked away in a pot. This man is made of gold and has a lot of money. That’s how he can afford to groom two mustaches at the same time. If anything should happen to one, he has plenty of back up mustaches in his mustache storage pot.
Picture this double mustachioed gold man as he rifles through his pot of mustaches. Imagine how ticklish they must be.
Reading Mnemonic
The mustachioed man’s wife asks if he loves his pot of mustaches more than he loves her. “Nah babe (なべ),” he says. “Nah, babe. Nah.”
Imagine yourself as this golden man with the mustache (and another mustache). Say “Nah, babe” over and over again like you’re trying to convince your wife that you actually love her more than your pot of luxurious mustaches.
